learningContent.title: Testing the DITA Open Toolkit installation

lcInstruction.p: troubleshooting common issues with DITA OT installation, setup, first build

task.title: Running a DITA OT test build on a PC

step.cmd: Type cd to navigate to the OT folder
Type the following string of commands to run the DITA OT:

info.p: bin\dita specifies that you are generating DITA output

-i tells the DITA OT the name and filepath of the DITA map or file that needs to be transformed into output.To enter the filepath and filename without typing it, navigate to the file on your system, click on the file's icon, and drag the icon directly into the command window.

-f tells the DITA OT which transtype, or output transformation type, to use. The transtype value indicates whether the output type should be PDF, HTML, webhelp, or any other format.For the purpose of this exercise, type pdf2 to generate output from the DITA OT's default PDF plugin.

-o tells the DITA OT where to store the generated output. If no output directory is specified, the DITA OT will place the output into its default "out" folder. To specify a directory without typing it, navigate to the folder on your system, click on the folder's icon, and drag the icon directly into the command window.
-v tells the DITA OT to display the command log as it generates the output. Typing this command is optional, but it is useful to watch the DITA OT run in realtime to help troubleshoot errors.

step.cmd: Press ENTER to run the DITA Open Toolkit.
Look in the output folder you specified with the -o command to see your generated output.
